repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Facilities Development Photos, Drawings, Records
did.abstract: Administrative and financial reports related to the Veterinary Hospital, as well as building plans and documents related to the General Engineering Building and Mechanical Engineering Shop from about 1930-1997.

bioghist.p: The WSU Physical Plant was originally known as Buildings and Grounds dating back to at least 1908 when a superintendent was appointed to the department. The department underwent a name change to Buildings and Grounds in the 1960's and a reorganizing in the 80's. The department is responsible for small scale construction and remodeling work around the WSU campus, as well as day to day maintenance.

scopecontent.p: Primarily contains administrative, budget, and construction reports related to the Veterinary Teaching Hospital. Also includes building plans and information on the General Engineering Building and the Mechanical Engineering Shop. All files range from 1930-1997.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
Box contains reports related to the Veterinary Teaching Hospital and are grouped together in acid-free folders and clearly labeled by subject matter and report type.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Facilities Development Photos, Drawings, Records, 1930-1997 (UA1999-18)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Rick Ward of Facilities on October 21, 1999 and retained as UA1999-18.

separatedmaterial.p: Photographs separated out to PC3 and PC 92.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
